redeem.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Olivier’s performance redeemed an otherwise second-rate play.
The hotel had a single redeeming feature – it was cheap.
redeem.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to exchange a piece of paper representing an amount of money for that amount of money or for goods equal in cost to that amount of money
redeem.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: You can redeem the coupon at any store.
redeem.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to free someone from the power of evil, especially in the Christian religion
redeem.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to buy back something which you left with someone you borrowed money from
redeem.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: He finally redeemed his watch from the pawnbroker.
redeem.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to pay off a loan or debt
redeem.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: He intends to redeem the mortgage at the earliest opportunity.
When do you expect to redeem this debt?
redeem.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to exchange shares, bonds etc for cash
redeem.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: A company will not normally be allowed to redeem its shares during the offer period if its board believes that a takeover offer is imminent.
redeem.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to get back something that you pawned (=left with someone when you borrowed money from them), by returning the money borrowed
